title: Side Bar Small Screen
description:
The side bar will change into a button menu when a certain threshold in viewport width is hit. To do this, we first get the dimensions of the webpage through the use of the "window.addEventListener" function with the target event of "resize".

We will then use the hook "useEffect" to trigger the function on every render of the webpage. Once we get the dimensions, we will then use it as a conditional so the react component could choose how to render the side bar. 

For the button menu, we will use the Button and Offcanvas component from the react-bootstrap which we can install through "npm install react-bootstrap bootstrap". 

We will use the Button as the trigger to open the Offcanvas menu through the use of the "onClick" event.

The Offcanvas menu will become the parent of the Collapsible we used on the side bar. We will then use the "show" property to pass a boolean variable to control the showing / hiding of the Offcanvas menu. Lastly, we will use the "onHide" event to trigger the hiding of the menu.
